result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank Byrd Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**Pay DNA surcharge.
Pay restiution plus surcharges.  State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  May Not have contact with Yolanda T or Charles  D unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

from Sarah Theiermann @ DOC

Defendant Frank  Byrd appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Reserve Judge Stephen A. Simanek, acting today only.
14CF931: Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1 Substantial Battery; found guilty by the court.
14CF938: Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1 BJ-Fel and Ct 3 Retail Theft ; found guilty by the court. Ct 2 dismissed on ST's motion.
14CM1247: Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1 Knowingly Violate Dom Abuse Injunction; found guilty by the court. Cts 2 & 3 dismissed but read in.
Presentence Investigation ordered. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 10/7/14 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.
